extendedInfo.description: Speccy is a Sinclair ZX Spectrum home computer emulator. It will run software written for Spectrum 16k, 48k, 128k, +2, +2A, +3, Timex Sinclair, Pentagon, and Skorpion home computers. Features:* Specifically optimized for Android devices, using ARM assembler and running at the same speed as a real Spectrum.* Full screen portrait mode emulation, with options for simulating TV scanlines and fuzzy TV display.* Records soundtrack to MIDI files.* Includes both physical and touch screen keyboard support.* Includes NetPlay functionality for playing over local network or Internet.* Includes WorldOfSpectrum.org software archive browser.* Supports snapshots (*.sna, *.z80).* Supports loading from tapes (*.tap, *.tzx files), with authentic tape sounds.* Supports TR-DOS and a variety of other disk image formats (*.trd, *.scl, *.fdi, *.dsk).* Supports 128k and Fuller sound chips.* Emulates Cursor, Protek, AGF, Kempston, and Sinclair Interface II joysticks, using touch screen, physical keyboard, or accelerometer.* Emulates Kempston mouse.* Emulates ZX Printer and other printers.Speccy package itself does not contain any Spectrum programs. You should place your own Spectrum files onto the SD card before running Speccy.Please, do not run any software you do not own with Speccy. The author cannot and will not tell you where to find free Spectrum programs.Please, report any encountered problems here:http://groups.google.com/group/emul8

reviews.title: No star for this
reviews.comment: I have used the desktop version of this, albeit an older version, and was pleased to see this development. But its functionality is too limted. I tried some of my own softwear that works on a real spectrum and it wouldnt load.  I had created successfull software for the spectrum back then. I think this app has posiblities,  however there can also be improvments. I dont mind the adds but the constant nags to pay for it is a problem. I will wait and try again at a later time. Uninstalled.
reviews.author: Mike Wray

reviews.title: Not the Best
reviews.comment: \"You get what you pay for\" is a bit of a tired mantra these days, it seems. Two other Speccy emulators, Marvin and the USP, are infinitely better than this. Both are completely free. Yes, this is also free; but this doesn\'t work fully. It\'s merely an advert for a version that supposedly does work, a version that would struggle to match Marvin and USP even if it does. Unimpressed.
reviews.author: Matthew Shute

reviews.title: Almost useless
reviews.comment: The first reason to uninstall it was displaying too often that I should upgrade to the full (paid) version. In the free version there\'s no instant loading, the games load 3-5 minutes, like in the 80s from a real tape.
reviews.author: Abrimaal Svartvinter

reviews.title: Scam app
reviews.comment: You cant run ANY game from WOS unless you buy the full version! What use is an emulator that cant run games? Also, hitting BACK takes you to the top of the list, not to where you were.
reviews.author: Gianluca Badejo

reviews.title: Ace
reviews.comment: A well thought out app
reviews.author: John Earnshaw

reviews.title: Free version is bad nagware
reviews.comment: App constantly nags you to buy the full version. Several features do not work until you pay. App cannot run any titles from World of Spectrum until you pay. If I could actually try the app out then I would consider buying it but certainly not when basic functionality does not work unless you pay. Shameless nagware.
reviews.author: Simon Osborne

reviews.title: Keyboard
reviews.comment: Who seriously thought this keyboard design was a good idea? I can\'t even make out the keys on the spectrum load screen, let alone text adventures. Uninstalled.
reviews.author: JM Sim

reviews.title: Games don\'t load
reviews.comment: I\'ve downloaded several games but hardly any of them run? Other emulators load these games fine. What\'s going on ?
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Lot of bugs
reviews.comment: I can\'t use on motorola defy plus. Slow menu responses, sometimes the main screen disappears. However it would be one of the best app, because i haven\'t seen specy emu, in which you can change the keyboard layout. (It doesn\'t work for me, if i rotate the phone) Please fix it
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Doesn\'t work.
reviews.comment: No longer loads games, going back to Marvin for my speccy fix.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Galaxy note
reviews.comment: Cannot load games, but I can conclude that the problems with all spectrum emulators in the market  its the keyboard and respective controls
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Good - a long way down the right path for me
reviews.comment: Starting to look really good.  Excellent that it is still being worked.  When a full speccy keyboard and Plus D interface come along it will be perfect and I\'d be more than happy to pay.  I know they are on the to do list.  Keep up the excellent development.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Good but
reviews.comment: Good, works well with lots of games, but I won\'t purchase it till I can get the number keys on this Xperia mini pro to work, they\'re shifted.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Problem with 1 game
reviews.comment: Grange Hill 128k version wont load while the 48k version does...
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Badprotozoa
reviews.comment: Awesome
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Speccy
reviews.comment: Great app that I used to have on my Nokia. There\'s 1 or 2 bugs with it that I\'m trying to see if it\'s a problem with me or not (can\'t get any games to load but loading sounds are heard). I use the Advent Vega (Android 2.2). The 1.7.3 release is much more stable. This emulator is by far the best and most promising. The others I\'ve tried but are over complicated or just won\'t work. This one is simple. Looking forward to watch updates on this. Great work!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Its crap
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Quite slow
reviews.comment: I have only tried one game - Bumpy - on this emulator. Works slowest compared to all other Android ZX emulators. I tried it on the Nexus One phone. Sticking with the Marvin for now, which has the best performance.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Works fine until the advert click
reviews.comment: Everything was fine until I was forced to click on an advert, the ad would not open and I could not run any other games. This is the same with all of the apps by this developer, they all do it.    Shame they dont offer a paid option for around a quid as I would probably pay for this and a couple of others but as it stands its a useless app
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Couldn\'t get it to work even after being forced to click on the adverts.
reviews.author: A Google User
